website_summaries.verdict: The price is up there, but this is a professional tool that will last and remain accurate. The best available.
pros: Reads quickly, large clamp, durable and accurate for linear and nonlinear jobs
cons: 600-volt and 400-amp limits may be too limiting for some professionals

customer_reviews.title: Top quality pro level meter
customer_reviews.text: Water well serviceman here. We use these pretty much exclusively. Tough, they survive bouncing around in a dirty truck. Accurate, I have checked them against more expensive meters. Easy to use, I can train new guys to use them in literally less than a minute. Long lasting, i have at least two of these in the field being used daily that we havent changed batteries in for at least two years. If you dont need a megger or something complicated but you use a meter every day this is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fluke make a high quality product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always heard that Fluke is a great brand. I never truly knew their quality until I got this meter. I use this for measuring amps on compressor leads and it helps verify power consumption. This is spot on compared to very expensive equipment we use for data logging. Glad I chose to go with the expensive one! If you have any questions about this review please email me at ReviewOne23@gmail.com!
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great amp meter, but also should get a line splitter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to measure amp draws for appliances so i could gauge how many watts I needed for a back up generator. In order to measure amps, you need to measure only one leg of the circuit. For an appliance, this meant splitting the cord or opening up the outlet so as to measure just one leg of the circuit. Much easier if you purchase a line splitter. ( Amprobe ELS2A AC Line Splitter) This meter is very accurate and sturdy and will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Blarneystone

customer_reviews.title: No probe holding slots like T5
customer_reviews.text: Good meter Fluke quality etc but if you are buying to replace a T5 model you may be dissapointed like I was that there are no slots for the probes like the T5. I miss the ability to snap the probes in the back and stuff in my back pocket. Porbably going to go back to my old T5 and toss this one in the workbox for everyone else to use.
customer_reviews.author: Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Great meter.  Fluke quality never fades.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Fluke. Built like a brick, works perfectly, and has a great design. Fantastic tool for measuring current without breaking into the circuit. Remember, you can't measure current by clamping an extension cord or a piece of romex. Current running out the black, and back on the white will cancel each other. You have to expose one wire to clamp that one to get a real current reading. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fluke is the best
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to meters, personally I think Fluke is the best. I am an electrician by trade for 22 years and that is all I use at work and decided it was time to buy one for myself for home use and side jobs. This Amp probe works perfectly and I wouldn't think of buying any other brand. Trust me, I do this for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a cheap meter you can grab ! Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: I love fluke ! I don’t think I would ever stray to another brand of test equipment. I’ve heard a lot of stories about the other brand and dramatic failures. This is a great meter to keep in your go bag for doing light commercial, industrial or residential work. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Another great Fluke product
customer_reviews.text: Been an electrician for years and used many Fluke meters including this modal. Got this one for the house and haven't been disappointed. Reliable, accurate, and priced right. The amp clamp is a must for checking amp draw both monitoring and troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mt Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Fluke hits another out of the park!
customer_reviews.text: Fluke has never made a bad product for me. Been using Fluke multi-meters for a long time, every one of them are still in perfect condition. The clamp meter can only be on one of the lines for AC to get a non-contact reading.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: It would of been nice to get a year out of it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for work. Needed the calibration papers and sticker for it. My only complaint is that the calibration is due in August of 2017 , and I bought it in March of 2017. It would of been nice to get a year out of it.....
customer_reviews.author: ralf townsley

customer_reviews.title: Poor test lead design
customer_reviews.text: Unit did not work because the leads did not make solid connection with the meter. Reason: the lead shrouds (plastic cylinders that cover the connectors) were way too long. I trimmed by 1/4" and the unit works fine. i will keep the unit because Fluke has always been a top notch brand. I have seen reviews elsewhere that mentioned this problem. Fluke design engineering needs to go back to the drawing board on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Poor design or quality control
customer_reviews.text: Battery contacts failed by beaking off. No excuse for this type of failure
customer_reviews.author: Pee Gee 808

customer_reviews.title: Solid, basic voltmeter and ammeter
customer_reviews.text: This is Fluke's bottom-of-the-line, cheapest handheld meter. It's basic with no fancy features. But it does the job. And its simplicity is a benefit. It works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Bucci

customer_reviews.title: Good meter
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Accuracy seems to be good when I've compared it with comparable meters at work. Only gripe is that it doesn't measure DC amps ~ I knew that before purchasing, didn't want to spend the extra $ Only problem is that the zipper failed on the case.
customer_reviews.author: Zeuss

customer_reviews.title: Great meter
customer_reviews.text: Some people have given me the impression fluke has fallen off... but this meter has always treated my very well and is of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Anhorn

customer_reviews.title: Fluke is the best equipment you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item to my grandson who just graduated from West Virginia University with a degree in Electrical Engineering. I know that Fluke makes the best electrical test equipment and that is why I ordered it for him.
customer_reviews.author: sanford n mock

customer_reviews.title: This product only work in AC.
customer_reviews.text: If you wok mainly in DC not buy this product. I recommend Fluke 325 because you can work in DC and AC.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Since Sliced Bread...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had a multi meter in the home. It's one of those tools you don't realize you can't live without until you had one. I guess I've been though 3 or 4 of the Radio Shack models and still have the last one I bought. But this one takes the prize of being the best one yet. Don't get me wrong I'm not throwing away my other unit, but the clamp on function of this model makes it a lot easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: No min/max recording feature
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I purchased the lower-cost model 323 to check ac current on various pumps around the property. However I was disappointed to discover that the 323 does not have the min/max recording feature for capturing instantaneous starting current. For that you need to purchase the model 325 for 2.5 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Other than that the meter is sturdy, simple
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! This meter is not backlit. I guess I didn't realize fluke would make a DMM that is not. The only other negative I have, is the leads, they are cheap and only lasted about a year. I think I will buy a set of leads and keep this meter in my home kit. Will upgrade to 324 or 325 for my work kit. Other than that the meter is sturdy, simple, and a good buy anyone who doesn't need the backlit feature.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M.

customer_reviews.title: like on the T-1000s
customer_reviews.text: As a commercial/industrial electrician my only complaint is the lack of slots built into the meter for holding the leads, like on the T-1000s. Sometimes it feels like you need 3 hands. Otherwise its fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fluke top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Came in a timely manner no delays from their end. Come with a nice pouch to hold everything when not in use and two wire probes along with clamp for testing. I have owned fluke before and you cant get any better really like the quality and reliability of this product . Very nice meter would definitely recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Islas

customer_reviews.title: Right product at the right price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, simple to use basic meter. I work in the film industry and use this meter frequently to check voltage and amperage on our generator runs at work. For what I need, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fluke clamp meter
customer_reviews.text: Great meter, very fast response time. Don't like the cost though but then who does.
customer_reviews.author: Bcon

customer_reviews.title: This is a great meter. Read the book that comes with it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great meter. Read the book that comes with it first. Having done that, you will understand the icons. It is almost fool proof, and unlike some meters, you do not have to move the leads around to do different testing
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Meter
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and well built Meter, which fluke has been known for.

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: I lost my previous Fluke meter which was a older model. I like this one much more than my previous one.

customer_reviews.title: Its a Fluke buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality meter nice affordable price. I'd recommend it to anyone starting a career in the electrical field

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for a lower end meter but the clamp makes up for it. Very accurate!

customer_reviews.title: Rip off.

customer_reviews.title: Take some getting used to but all in all good meter.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but is quite sensitive. Take some getting used to but all in all good meter.

customer_reviews.title: Wire leads are faulty.
customer_reviews.text: Wire leads are faulty, contact is not reliable they become loose, you got to doble chech they are making contact to get the right reading. Again not reliable. I do not have the time to keep veryfing the wire leads are making contact.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Basic function meter. Great brand. Reliable works great 6mo in.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron from Philly

customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression this was a new meter I was purchasing for work but it wasn't and I'm very disappointed not sure what to do

customer_reviews.title: I love these little clamp meters
customer_reviews.text: My 322 got stolen, so I bought this to replace it. I love these little clamp meters, they do everything I need and more; I work as an electrician and touring audio engineer. I uses these meters every day to test power and driver loads.

customer_reviews.title: Simple straightforward and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple straightforward and easy to use. Reliable measurements. Was purchased as a replacement for a Fluke 30 that was damaged beyond repair. I purchased a Craftsman Clamp meter it failed straight out of the box. I went cheap instead of quality big mistake! I returned the Craftman and invested the refund wisely into the Fluke.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great little meter for the money fits right in my tool bag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!

customer_reviews.title: Seems good to me
customer_reviews.text: I am not a knowledgeable electronics guy so do not put too much into my opinion but I do like this meter and it seems to do everything I want it to.

customer_reviews.title: Good meter.
customer_reviews.text: Good meter but I exchanged it for the 325 as I wanted to read DC current.

customer_reviews.text: I love my meter. I use it daily and I would absolutely buy this again.

customer_reviews.title: Great Meter and Leads Are Not Defective
customer_reviews.text: This is a great meter. Contrary to my earlier review and others here, the leads are not defective; the plug end merely needs to be jiggled a little while inserting, and it goes right in to full depth.

customer_reviews.title: For me you can be confident if you buy Fluke!!

customer_reviews.text: I trust fluke meters. I've had Klein and a few cheapie meters in the past that have tried to kill me. That said this meter feels cheap, overly bulky for what it is, and the hold button is to easy to engage without realizing it. I guess that's what you get at this price point. In conclusion I trust this fluke will keep me alive long enough to save for a higher end (300-400$)meter.

customer_reviews.text: The absolute best brand of metering equipment money can possibly buy. My 323 is a super simple and easy to use, my nieces can use it. Any other brand of meter is trash, except maybe FLIR. If anyone hands me a field piece, or a Klein, I just want to swing it around the room by the leads and throw it out the window into oncoming traffic, hoping an armored battalion just so happens to be driving by to smash their stupid meter to a fine dust.

product_meta.title: Fluke 323 True-RMS Clamp Meter
product_meta.description: Style:StandardThe Fluke true rms clamp meter is a great clamp meter for general, grab and go troubleshooting needs. The Fluke 323 323 AMZN is ideally suited for current measurements up to 400 a in tight cable compartments.
feature_bullets: Digital clamp meter measures ac current to 400 amp, AC and DC voltage to 600 v, and resistance to 4 kilohms. Does not measure dc current
True RMS sensing meter provides accurate readings when measuring linear or non linear loads, regardless of waveform
Jaw opening measures current in a conductor upto 30 millimeter without touching or interrupting the circuit. Resistance accuracy: 1.0% ± 5 digits
Audible continuity sensor confirms that the circuit conducts electricity
Meets IEC safety standard 61010 1, and is rated for CAT IV installations to 300V and CAT III installations to 600V

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
